alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Forsyth County through 400 PM EDT... At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huntsville, or 8 miles north of Mocksville, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Clemmons, Huntsville and Lewisville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
